project.title: GREEN AMBASSADORS CLUB
project.description:
### 🌍 The Challenge We’re Tackling 

Kimi Island, Uganda, is home to around 5,500 residents in the communities of Kimi Kachanga and Kimi Banga. These residents face urgent challenges: inadequate infrastructure, poor healthcare access, environmental degradation, and the lasting impact of a devastating fire in 2017. Without action, the community—especially youth and vulnerable families—will continue to face hardships and limited opportunities.

### 📜 Our Solution

The Kimi Restoration Campaign is a community-led initiative launched in response to these challenges. Spearheaded by the Green Ambassadors Club and supported by partners, the campaign takes a holistic approach focused on:
- 💪 Youth empowerment through skills training in soap making and reusable sanitary towel production.
- 🌿 Environmental conservation and the promotion of sustainable, local livelihoods.
- ⚕️ Healthcare improvement, including installing solar-powered systems for medicine storage, advocating for a stationed nurse, and organizing medical camps—one recently served 1,500 residents.
- 🔆 Clean energy access via the distribution of solar lamps to students and families.
- 🚻 Improved hygiene and sanitation with new restrooms near schools and the clinic.

### 🌱 Our Organisation / Community

This initiative is driven by local leaders, youth, and families on Kimi Island. Together, we are working to build a healthier, more self-reliant, and environmentally responsible future.

### 🖼️ See Our Impact

![Kimi Restoration Impact Image](https://www.ecocertain.xyz/_next/image?url=%2Fapi%2Fhypercert-image%2F42220-0x16bA53B74c234C870c61EFC04cD418B8f2865959-57848002376559538788773683263400595947520&w=640&q=75)

### 🔗 [View Our Hypercert](https://ecocertain.vercel.app/hypercert/42220-0x16bA53B74c234C870c61EFC04cD418B8f2865959-58528567110401415715700432478264132370432)

### 📝 What This Hypercert Represents
- Trained 500 youth and single mothers in soap, Vaseline, and reusable product making.
- Provided food and clothing to vulnerable families.
- Installed solar systems in clinics and distributed solar lights.
- Organized medical camps serving hundreds of residents.
- Built community restrooms to improve hygiene standards.

###  ✅ Proof That It’s Working

We’ve collected photos, testimonials, and data that showcase the tangible results of our work.

### 📂 [See the Proof of Impact](https://photos.app.goo.gl/V6CQzq79PJ1Egwc6A)
